text: hi welcome back to my cupcake addiction
today we're going to be making miniature
laptop cupcakes and I'm actually teaming
up with the guys over at Squarespace
they're making the web a better place by
helping people to create great online
content so I thought mini laptop
computers was the perfect way to
collaborate with them on this video I'll
leave a link down below if you want to
find out more about Squarespace today's
laptops can be color-coordinated so Mac
or PC I got you covered to make your
little laptops you going to need
obviously a cupcake defrost I've also
got something that perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting I'm going with
purple today but any color you like I'll
link to that recipe down below I've got
some cornflour in a shaker a paintbrush
a sharp knife a regular knife and then a
really small sharp pointy knife I've got
some tap water these are just two
standard sized Lego bricks stuck
together which is the perfect size to
you guys to measure at your laptop
screens I'm making a plain black laptop
today so I'm just going to be using
black fondant but if you wanted to make
your Apple Mac laptop you'd need gray
and white whatever color you like I've
got a fondant rolling pin and I'm doing
fancy on my computer screens and using
edible images so if you don't have
access to an edible printer I will link
to the template down below and you can
most of the time send that to your local
cake decorating store and they'll print
it out they're edible printers for you
I've got some aluminium foil for setting
our little laptop shapes on today and
I've also got just a craft mat or a
chopping board so that we don't damage
adventures let's get into it the first
thing that you want to do is you want to
tear off a decent length of your
aluminum foil and it doesn't really
matter how much fold it in half and keep
it as flat as you possibly can while
you're folding it and then fold it in
half again make sure you're not adding
any creases to it and that you're
getting your seams or your folds really
nice and neat and sharp and all up you
want to fold this about four times so
it's got enough strength to support your
laptop open it up so it resembles an
open laptop and put it off to the side
sprinkle down a tiny bit of your
cornflour not too much or you'll end up
with white spots all through your black
fondant and then swipe your black
fondant around in that cornflour before
rolling it out don't roll your fondant
out too thin here and I'll also mention
that I've added a little bit of
halos or CMC powder to help mindset a
lot faster if you don't have that powder
you can still do it they're going to
take 12 to 24 hours to set if you have
the toilers or CMC they're going to set
about 6 you can see I'm just rubbing the
top of my Fonda and also the back to
make sure that I've got no white spots
on there and then taking your two Lego
bricks which I measured out as being the
perfect size for these tiny little
laptop screens place it down so you've
got enough room around the outside for a
little outer edge of your computer
screen and then push it down really
firmly that's going to make the indent
for your computer screen and somewhere
that we can stick those edible images
once you've done that when you're going
to a very very faint outline for your
keyboard but you don't want this to be
too deep here so leave a gap in between
the screen and the keyboard about double
the width of the outside edge of your
little laptops and then just position
your Lego book again and gently press it
down not too hard
taking your knife now you want to cut on
either side of your two little Lego
brick marks leaving that little gap for
the outer edges of your screen and also
of your keyboard cutting away the top
and the bottom you should have a nice
rectangle peace feel keyboard now you
just want to use the edge of your Lego
block and you're going to place that in
you need five rows of keys in total so
you need six of these little lines you
can see I'm just tilting the Lego block
and then pressing it down quite firmly
not enough to cut through the fondant
but firm enough to give me a nice little
indent for those keyboard keys using the
narrow edge of your Lego blocks you just
want to mark out three lines evenly
spaced on either side we're going to do
the other ones with a knife because you
want to leave that bottom line as a
space bar so taking the back of my knife
not the sharp point I want the fatter
back I'm going to just position right at
the top so you'll notice here that I put
the point of the knife into the top of
the line and just do the first two keys
and then I turn the knife upside down
and kind of come at it backwards rather
than trying to do the whole line because
you'll never get a neat finish so the
point of that knife goes again up
against the space bar to do those bottom
two keys that's the neatest way I found
to achieve this look press the knife in
where the top two keys in the bottom two
keys joiner and that's your key board
all done to make a little trackpad I'm
using the back of my knife again and
just doing two short lines and two
longer lines to create just a small
indented
tangle in the bottom section of your
computer I'm continually checking with
my laptops are straight because you
don't want these edges to be anything
other than dead straight so just grab a
ruler and a knife or a couple of rulers
and just press them up to the edges to
make sure you've got that beautiful
straight edge rectangle take your edible
image now and if you're having trouble
getting this off the backing paper I
like to use a really thin knife and just
slide it in between the image in the
backing paper but if you're having any
trouble pop it in the freezer for five
minutes before you attempt to remove it
it'll make it a bit easier to handle
handle your edible images really
carefully and if you can't find them or
you don't have access to them you can
just use thinly rolled white fondant and
some edible markers to make your own
designs take a little bit of that water
not too much and make sure that you're
getting it right into the corners of
your little computer screen indent make
sure you completely coat that but really
you don't need to dip it more than once
or twice you don't want too much water
on your screen just a really thin coat
take your edible image now and pop it
straight into that little indent which
should be about the perfect size but you
will need to take just the back of your
knife and just press it gently around
all four edges to make sure it's really
nice and flush with your laptop screen
to finish your laptop you just need to
take your sharp knife now and with the
sharp side push in an indent right in
between the base of the screen and the
top of the keyboard it needs to be quite
deep but don't cut through so something
like this take your alfoil
laptop stand now and when you've got
five or six of this it will have a bit
of weight and it so you can rest it up
against the elf oil box just to give it
a bit of support fold your laptop in
half on that little seam that you've cut
and when you place it onto the stand
make sure that the back of the screen is
flush up against that foil to make your
little tiny mice now you're taking a
really really small little ball of
fondant and you just want to roll it
into a ball and then rock it into kind
of like a bit of a jellybean shape then
you want to take a really sharp knife
and I'm just going to make one little
line across the front about a third of
the way down and then one coming right
down towards the front of that piece
down towards the center kind of looking
like simple Mouse with little mouse
buttons to frost your cupcake in that
flat top style you want to scoop on a
ton of frosting more than you're going
to need and then use the back of the
knife to kind of squish it down so it's
going out over the edges of the cupcake
case while at the back of your knife
and then just run the flat back of your
knife around the edges to give you that
sort of high flat edge and then you want
to use the back of the knife again just
to flatten off the top as smooth as you
can get it this is a great style of
frosting that doesn't need any fancy
equipment take your little laptop now
and you want to stick it straight down
onto the cupcake with that little mouse
beside it so you've got your completed
laptop cupcakes these are only gorgeous
perfect for any tech nerds perfect for
any of you guys that absolutely love
your laptops thanks again to Squarespace
for the inspiration to create these
gorgeous little mini laptop cupcakes
make sure you check out that link down
below if you want to find out more about
them and also for 10% off your my
cupcake addiction viewer thanks very
much for watching
